Key Match Events: Luis Gil had a no-hitter through 3.1 innings before Cody Bellinger doubled in the fourth.
Luis Gil allowed only one hit over six scoreless innings, striking out seven and walking two.
Aaron Judge doubled down the third-base line to score the game’s first run.
Austin Wells drove in two more runs with a single to give New York a 3-0 lead.
New York's bullpen, including Jake Cousins, Tommy Kahnle, and Luke Weaver, each pitched a scoreless inning to close out the game.
Luke Weaver recorded his first save of the season.
Post-Match Reflections: Luis Gil expressed satisfaction with his performance in his first start since returning from the injured list.
The Yankees highlighted the importance of Gil's performance for their postseason aspirations.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Anthony Rizzo received a warm welcome from the crowd at Wrigley Field in his first at-bat since joining the Yankees in 2021.
The Yankees paired timely hitting with superb pitching to secure the win.
